intro: Tephrosia rhodesica var. rhodesica, commonly known as Rhodesian tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, and it has compound leaves with opposite arrangement. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of bioactive compounds.
